name: Brazilian Music
description: All forms of music with roots in Brazil.

children.name: Brazilian Classical Music
children.description: Originated in the late 19th century, taking the European music that had been brought to the country by colonists and brought in parts of Brazilian Music.

children.name: Brazilian Folk Music
children.description: Comprises the various traditions of folk music found in Brazil, often resulting from the interplay of Indigenous, African and European music.

children.name: Brega
children.description: Overstated, dramatic music with a romantic singing style.

children.name: Dobrado
children.description: Brazilian musical genre, played by military bands with wooden, brass and also percussive instruments.

children.name: Funk brasileiro
children.description: Hip Hop-influenced dance style originating from the favelas of Rio de Janeiro and known primarily as "funk" in Brazil.

children.name: MPB
children.description: Short for música popular brasileira; formed in the mid-1960s as a modernized version of Bossa nova and Samba-canção.

children.name: Northeastern Brazilian Music
children.description: Regional styles that combines elements of indigenous, African and European traditions, historically with a focus on life of the northeastern people, such as drought, migration, the struggle for survival, love and nostalgia, and often danced in intense and accelerated movements.

children.name: Northern Brazilian Music
children.description: Regional styles rooted in Northern Brazil, often influenced by Caribbean rhythms and instrumentations, usually with focus on romance, celebrations, the relationship between the man and the Amazon rainforest, and danced in fast and sensual movements.

children.name: Rock rural
children.description: Brazilian Folk Rock that emerged in the 1970s, incorporating elements of Sertanejo, Country Rock, and MPB.

children.name: Samba
children.description: Originated in the 19th century from a blend of various rhythmic styles of African Music, forming a new sound, structure, and a dance of the same name.

children.name: Sertanejo
children.description: Acoustic guitar-based and originated from the rural parts of Brazilian Center-South region.

children.name: Southeastern Brazilian Music
children.description: Regional styles of diverse cultural expressions rooted in Southeastern Brazil that combine elements of African Music and European Music.

children.name: Southern Brazilian Music
children.description: Traditional music originating from Southern Brazil.
